pwe_level_ussingen_devastation_01: There's no reviving this carcass of a town.
pwe_level_ussingen_devastation_02: Waste no time sifting through the ashes, there's nothing there for us.
pwe_level_ussingen_devastation_03: This town was lost long before we arrived, lumberfoots. Spare me your sorrows.
pwe_level_ussingen_devastation_04: Another dark dream come to fruition. The path ahead is bleaker still.
pwe_level_ussingen_doomed_town_01: Trapped in a ruined town, surrounded by bloodthirsty scunners. What a splendid day.
pwe_level_ussingen_doomed_town_02: The Empire has one less town. Well, that's one less town to disappoint.
pwe_level_ussingen_doomed_town_03: Ussingen's not for saving, mayflies. But we can still make its destroyers pay a fine price.
pwe_level_ussingen_doomed_town_04: I've seen this before. This is the fate of the world.
pwe_level_ussingen_escape_01: Through the gate, mayflies, cut through the filth!
pwe_level_ussingen_escape_02: Gate's open! Lumberfoot your way through, lumberfoots!
pwe_level_ussingen_escape_03: That's gates our only exit, push through!
pwe_level_ussingen_escape_04: More of them! Make for the gate!
pwe_level_ussingen_find_way_around_01: Don't waste time here, mayflies, find a way around.
pwe_level_ussingen_find_way_around_02: We have to go around, lumberfoots! Move!
pwe_level_ussingen_find_way_around_03: I'd say we step sideways, find a way around the wall.
pwe_level_ussingen_find_way_around_04: Find a way around, into the courtyard!
pwe_level_ussingen_gatehouse_01: Strung from the gatehouse like sacks of meat...
pwe_level_ussingen_gatehouse_02: These Northlanders think themselves masters of cruelty, but I have kin who could show them a trick or two.
pwe_level_ussingen_gatehouse_03: The gate's open. Quickly! Before they've a chance to close it!
pwe_level_ussingen_gatehouse_04: Cruelty is a language spoken by all races.
pwe_level_ussingen_gate_closed_01: If we can't go through, we should go around.
pwe_level_ussingen_gate_closed_02: That gate doesn't look much for cooperating, mayflies.
pwe_level_ussingen_gate_closed_03: The road is sealed tight, but there must be some way around.
pwe_level_ussingen_gate_closed_04: We cannot open that gate. But we're not thwarted so easily.
pwe_level_ussingen_hurry_01: Are we waiting for someone else, mayflies?
pwe_level_ussingen_hurry_02: Is there a reason you're dragging your heels?
pwe_level_ussingen_hurry_03: Do you want me to leave you behind?
pwe_level_ussingen_less_damaged_01: Are we heading into the wealthy district?
pwe_level_ussingen_less_damaged_02: This area is less ravaged. Any theories, mayflies?
pwe_level_ussingen_less_damaged_03: This district is suspiciously intact. Someone here made a deal, perhaps?
pwe_level_ussingen_less_damaged_04: The scunners were less eager with their torches here. I wonder why?
pwe_level_ussingen_manor_found_01: So here it is. Like Lohner said.
pwe_level_ussingen_manor_found_04: There it is. Now let's remove it from this unhappy world.
pwe_level_ussingen_marktplatz_02: Even their burning flesh smells somehow... primitive.
pwe_level_ussingen_marktplatz_03: The fires burn to draw the Dark Gods' gaze. Best it finds us elsewhere.
pwe_level_ussingen_marktplatz_04: Behold, the world the scunners will leave us, if they remain unchecked.
pwe_level_ussingen_search_for_manor_01: So where's this wretched manor, mayflies?
pwe_level_ussingen_search_for_manor_02: Keep your eyes open for the manor. The smoke doesn't help.
pwe_level_ussingen_search_for_manor_03: Can we please find the manor and get back into fresh air?
pwe_level_ussingen_search_for_manor_04: To think we're actually going to cause more destruction to this town.
pwe_level_ussingen_spotting_manor_01: There's the manor, mayflies, up on the hill.
pwe_level_ussingen_spotting_manor_02: There it is - the baron's manor.
pwe_level_ussingen_spotting_manor_04: There! The manor's still standing. For now.
pwe_level_ussingen_spotting_town_01: I hope you're not expecting survivors, lumberfoots.
pwe_level_ussingen_spotting_town_02: There you have it. The blackened remains of your mayfly town.
pwe_level_ussingen_spotting_town_03: There's what's left of your town, mayflies.
pwe_level_ussingen_spotting_town_04: Your town's suffered at darkling hands, mayflies. How will you repay them?
pwe_level_ussingen_stockpile_burned_02: (laugh) Sometimes it's the simple things you treasure.
pwe_level_ussingen_stockpile_burned_04: (laugh) There'll be hungry scunners in the Reikland tonight!
pwe_level_ussingen_story_eight_01: Didn't seem that way at Morgensloft.
pwe_level_ussingen_story_eight_02: They'd never have fitted you in one of those cages. Never was the phrase 'stout fellow' so apt.
pwe_level_ussingen_story_five_01: And you as vocal as ever. What would you have me say?
pwe_level_ussingen_story_five_02: I have nothing to confess to you.
pwe_level_ussingen_story_five_03: Regrets are for mayflies, and my penance is my own.
pwe_level_ussingen_story_one_01: Famous? Not to speak ill of the dead, but it's a nothing town in a backward realm.
pwe_level_ussingen_story_one_02: I should show more cheese? Has all that ale finally rotted your brain, Kruber?
pwe_level_ussingen_story_seven_01: Typical scunners. No purpose, no strategy. Even the ratmen wanted Ubersreik for their own. This is slaughter for its own sake.
pwe_level_ussingen_story_seven_03: That's different. It's family. It's always different with family.
pwe_level_ussingen_story_ten_01: No. No granaries. More supply wagons than I can count. But I prefer a moving target.
pwe_level_ussingen_story_three_01: And I doubt you'll recognise much of it now.
pwe_level_ussingen_story_three_02: What? I meant it as reassurance!
pwe_level_ussingen_story_three_03: At least I don't speak like I've a mouth full of pebbles.
pwe_level_ussingen_story_twelve_01: At least the trees have survived.
pwe_level_ussingen_thick_smoke_01: Watch for movement. They'll use the smoke as cover!
pwe_level_ussingen_thick_smoke_02: The smoke and ash are their forest - they'll use it to hide, mayflies.
pwe_level_ussingen_thick_smoke_03: (cough) Drycha's spite, the smoke burns my eyes.
pwe_level_ussingen_thick_smoke_04: (cough) Unlike some of you, I've never enjoyed inhaling filthy smoke.
pwe_level_ussingen_way_through_01: The streets are blocked, but we'll find a way through.
pwe_level_ussingen_way_through_02: The streets are full of rubble, but it's too late to go back. Better press on.
pwe_level_ussingen_way_through_03: There has to be a way through. Look harder, mayflies!
pwe_level_ussingen_way_through_04: Come on lumberfoots. Find a way through!
pwe_level_ussingen_what_next_01: Find the black powder in the Mining Emporium so we can blow up that tasteless building.
pwe_level_ussingen_what_next_02: If the Mining Emporium's empty, we'll have to improvise... and Lohner won't like it when I improvise on him for not keeping his promises.
pwe_level_ussingen_what_next_03: Lumberfoot your way to the Mining Emporium. We have filthy black powder to fetch.
pwe_level_ussingen_what_next_04: Search for the Mining Emporium. We need its black powder, unfortunately.
pwe_level_ussingen_wine_cellar_01: Stinks like a Bretonnian boudoir in here.
pwe_level_ussingen_wine_cellar_02: Full barrels? If the northlanders won't touch this muck, neither should we.
pwe_level_ussingen_wine_cellar_03: Wine? We could drop in a speck of poison, just in case?
pwe_level_ussingen_wine_cellar_04: Wine so sour even scunners won't drink it...
pwe_level_ussingen_wrong_way_01: We're not getting through, mayflies. Maybe there's a way below?
pwe_level_ussingen_wrong_way_02: This is not the way, mayflies.
pwe_level_ussingen_wrong_way_03: We've strayed from our path, lumberfoots. Look for another way.
pwe_level_ussingen_wrong_way_04: Ach, there's no way through. We need to find our path.
pwe_light_weave_conversation_three_01: My cousin Araloth once spoke of a land far to the south, where undead monarchs worship light and dark in equal measure.
pwe_light_weave_conversation_three_02: Hush! Nothing good comes from uttering that name.
pwe_light_weave_conversation_two_01: Not everything can be an explosion, wizard.
pwe_magnus_tower_intro_a_01: We must lift the veil of ignorance. Make for the tower!
pwe_magnus_tower_intro_a_02: Come on, lumberfoots. The tower's this way.
pwe_magnus_tower_intro_b_01: Careless haste buys us nothing but a quick death.
pwe_magnus_tower_intro_b_02: Watch every shadow. There are skaven everywhere.
pwe_magnus_tower_intro_c_01: Caution is good. Precision in thought and deed is better.
pwe_magnus_tower_intro_c_02: They are only rats. Treat them as such.
pwe_mine_intro_a_01: If Lohner wants this done, why's he sat on his fat arse while we're out here in the cold?
pwe_mine_intro_a_02: Is this really necessary? Only fun so far is seeing you mayflies shiver in the cold.
pwe_mine_intro_b_01: Oh joy. A deep, dark hole. I doubt we'll find much to our liking.
pwe_mine_intro_c_01: Well, Perhaps we can learn a trick or two from the sorcerers - stiffen Kruber's wits so he can count up to five?
pwe_mine_intro_c_02: Well, the world has enough horrors. Let's stop more from being created down below.
pwe_nurgle_intro_a_01: Scunners, mayflies, they all come and go in an instant. If Olesya's plan is solid, we'll just send this one off again,
pwe_nurgle_intro_a_02: The monolith's only a thousand years old? Barely an eyeblink, mayflies. Now, Olesya's plan - you did pay attention?
pwe_nurgle_intro_b_01: I trust her observations, and I trust her plan. Attack the 'buboes' until the cavern is about to collapse, then make our way out. Simple enough, lumberfoots.
pwe_nurgle_intro_b_02: Aye, the plan. If you mayflies deviate from it, you're on your own, and gods help you should you lumber into my path.
pwe_nurgle_intro_c_01: Scunner edifices are poison on the Weave. Burying it should only be temporary measure.. Move, lumberfoots.
pwe_nurgle_intro_c_02: Should we be closer to Athel Loren, Spellsingers would have razed this Scunner soul-stone long ago. But unfortunately, we're not.
pwe_objective_achieved_all_but_one_goal_: It's not that hard, surely? Finish it.
Aye, that one as well, lumberfoots.
pwe_objective_cemetery_bringing_down_fir: You want applause? There are still three more.
pwe_objective_cemetery_bringing_down_fou: Get out of the way, lumberfoots!
pwe_objective_cemetery_destroyed_plague_: It's coming down around us! Get out!
I'll not be buried in this foetid chamber.
Let the weave swallow this place forever.
pwe_objective_cemetery_spotting_crypt_ma: Keep together. This place is a labyrinth.
A perfect spot for an ambush. Eyes sharp, lumberfoots.
A warren of stone to conceal our prey. You make things too easy for them, lumberfoots.
pwe_objective_cemetery_spotting_graveyar: Watch your step. This morass is treacherous.
You should burn or entomb your dead, not leave them in the mud.
A sorry monument to your ancestors, but our path leads us through it.
pwe_objective_cemetery_spotting_hedge_ma: A maze within a maze. I had a dream like this, once.
Into the maze. Lileath will guide us through.
We cannot go around. We must find a way through.
Tread slowly - we cannot afford to be separated.
pwe_objective_cemetery_spotting_mausoleu: That light is vermin-work, or I'm a dwarf.
What foulness awaits us, I wonder?
Watch where you tread, and touch nothing. There is vile magic ahead.
pwe_objective_cemetery_spotting_plague_b: Tracks so bright a dwarf could follow them.
These will lead us to something... Maybe answers... Maybe our own deaths.
I thought vermin were cunning. They could not signpost their presence more clearly.
pwe_objective_cemetery_spotting_plague_c: Shatter the cauldron! That should lift its curse.
The air trembles with corruption! The cauldron must be destroyed.
It is a blasphemy to the Weave - destroy it!
The cauldron! It contains enough poison to destroy the city.
pwe_objective_cemetery_spotting_plague_p: No mortal fire can burn this plague away.
The vermin can harm them no more.
The whole city will meet this fate, unless we succeed.
pwe_objective_cemetery_spotting_skaven_t: So, this is where they've gnawed through.
I knew they'd not be far away.
pwe_objective_cemetery_spotting_the_atta: We need to sever its support!
Smash the chains, and the cauldron will fall!
pwe_objective_cemetery_spotting_victim_0: They scavenge the dead. But why?
The vermin are hoarding the dead.
pwe_objective_cemetery_through_crypt_a_0: There might be a way in through that crypt.
The spirits in this place are feeble things. I will risk that crypt, even if you will not.
We can't walk around in circles all night. What about that way?
I doubt it was built as a gate, but it will serve as one now.
pwe_objective_cemetery_through_crypt_b_0: I knew I'd be scrabbling in the dark like a dwarf before we were done.
Forgive our trespass, spirits. Need drives us.
Our course leads down. Do we follow?
pwe_objective_cemetery_through_crypt_c_0: The stone yawns wide once more.
This one. I can feel it.
pwe_objective_correct_path_bridge_14: This way! Over the bridge, mayflies!
pwe_objective_correct_path_bridge_15: I'm at the bridge! Goddess, you're slow.
pwe_objective_correct_path_bridge_16: Come to the bridge, mayflies! Run!
pwe_objective_correct_path_door_03: I'm at the door! Come on!
pwe_objective_correct_path_down_05: Lumberfoots? Can you not see this is the path?
pwe_objective_correct_path_down_06: Down here, are you all blind?
pwe_objective_correct_path_ladder_up_04: What are you waiting for, lumberfoots? Up the ladder.
pwe_objective_correct_path_street_07: Are you blind? This is the route.
pwe_objective_correct_path_street_08: I see the path! Follow me!
pwe_objective_dropping_grimoire_03: We should never have touched it.
pwe_objective_dropping_grimoire_04: I carried its weight in my heart as much as on my shoulders.
pwe_objective_dropping_grimoire_05: It will find us again. It knows us now.
pwe_objective_dropping_grimoire_06: Pray its masters never seek us out.
pwe_objective_dropping_grimoire_07: The grimoire has fled. I hope it never returns.
pwe_objective_dropping_grimoire_08: The book has gone, but has left my soul branded.
pwe_objective_dropping_grimoire_09: That's better. Perhaps now the voices will cease.
pwe_objective_dropping_grimoire_10: Ach! It is not worth the burden.
pwe_objective_dropping_grimoire_11: I'll carry that cursed dross no longer.
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_back_to_ferr: The river and the ferry - that's our only hope now.
Are you more afraid of water than you are of the rats? The ferry. Now!
You'd give up so soon? Head for the river!
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_boat_arrives: Gnaw on each other vermin! We're away.
The boat's here. Quickly now, mayflies!
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_crescendo_st: Oh, splendid. I'm sure the vermin will never find us now.
What a din. They'll hear that in Ulthuan!
Watch the tree-line, lumberfoots, they'll be coming.
What a noise. Is that bell cast from lead?
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_doomwheel_ob: That's the last. We shouldn't linger.
(laugh) Watch that wreckage fly! Time to leave.
Did we need blackfire for that? It was already falling apart.
It's done. Can we go now?
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_finding_expl: Blackfire to destroy vermin machines. There's bleak poetry in that.
It's a crude method, but I suppose it will serve.
I loathe using this, but we have time for nothing else.
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_reaching_ska: At last! But where are those vile machines?
Thick with warpstone. Even dwarfs have more sense than this.
The machines will be here somewhere.
Let's be quick. The stench of this place turns my stomach.
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_ring_bell_02: We need to wake the old mother! Ring the bell!
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_ring_bell_03: That bell! It must summon the ferry.
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_ring_bell_04: We've little choice - ring the bell!
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_spotting_bri: The bridge, lumberfoots! While we still can!
That bridge may yet save us.
To the bridge, mayflies. Or are you ready to die here?
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_spotting_coa: The inn offers salvation, if only for a short time.
The inn, lumberfoots. Pick up your pace!
In the distance. I think it's the inn.
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_spotting_fir: Oh, the pure evil in these designs!
We must destroy these rat-wheels and we must do it fast.
Before they activate them, destroy them all!
These things cannot be let loose upon the world.
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_spotting_lod: Those ruins, a vestige of daemon essence remains... stay clear.
The weave contorts in pain around those ruins. Daemonic evil.
Avoid those ruins, by all means. I sense Daemon presence lingering.
The ruins speak of evil, do not listen to their calling.
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_spotting_rui: It smells of old magic here. Old magic and dark gods.
Natural death is one thing, but there is nothing natural about this.
This is the work of the Corruptor's children.
The dark children of the woods. I shall not speak their names...
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_spotting_tru: Inside that hollow trunk! Seems the only way.
Only way forward seems through that hollow trunk.
pwe_objective_forest_ambush_spotting_wat: That tower ruin is along our way.
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_escape_01: Come. We've done all we can!
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_escape_02: There is nothing left for us in this place.
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_escape_03: Come, lest you want to be rat-food.
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_escape_04: Escape! And not a heartbeat too soon.
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_escape_05: The Gods have shown us the way. Do not linger.
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_escape_06: Blessed Gods. Our tale doesn't end here.
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_escape_07: I'm leaving. Stay if you wish.
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_escape_08: Your choice is simple. Follow me and live, or remain behind to die.
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_escape_10: You want to be eaten alive? Move!
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_escape_12: It's past time we left, mayflies.
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_more_left_01: A glimpse of green does not guarantee spring.
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_more_left_02: We've more to do. Don't stop.
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_more_left_03: There's little time. Pick up the pace.
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_more_left_04: It's a start, but there's more to do.
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_more_left_07: If we go any slower at this, we'll be stopped.
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_more_left_10: Why celebrate? We have yet to finish.
pwe_objective_goal_achieved_more_left_12: It's only a start, lumberfoots. We've more yet.
pwe_objective_interacting_with_objective: Once again, you depend on me.
Do not distract me. This is important.
This seems simple enough. Like a dwarf.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_arriving_late: Do you always let them take your towns so easily?
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_call_elevator: It is a mixed fortune. Escape, but in a cage. I wish there was another way.
The way is open. Quickly, find the cage's release.
There, through the wall! Does that contraption still function?
This is our path? A lifting cage? Goddess.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_crescendo_sta: We're trapped. I hope you're satisfied.
Did no one bring a climbing rope?
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_elevator_open: Thank Lileath! The lifting cage is here!
That's it? The thing's falling apart.
From a trap to a cage? They're the rats, not us.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_entering_guar: They're dead. It falls to us, then.
They are slain, but the warning must be given.
Fear not, watchmen. The horn will be sounded.
How lovely, another burden to bear. Where's that signal horn?
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_finding_explo: Blackfire. Now that's a solution to our gate problem.
Blackfire. Seldom welcome, always useful. Goodbye, gate.
We have a choice: blow the gate, or fail. I say we take our chances with the blackfire.
Is that gate really serving much of a purpose? I say we blow it apart.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_hint_blow_hor: I bet some of you would even enjoy hearing that horrible horn again.
That noise was terrible, could we get a better tone out that horn?
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_how_to_escape: First, we sound the alarm. Then, we escape. It is but a small thing.
Until we sound the horn, the future holds no meaning.
We'll warn the city. Then we give the vermin a reason to fear us.
Your breath for winding that horn, your strength for the fight.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_over_rooftops: It would be a fine view, were there anything but squalor and ruin to see.
Even up here, the air stinks.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_reaching_top_: Give the warning! Rouse the city!
The vermin will come for us the moment it's blown.
Must we draw attention to ourselves wherever we go?
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_seeing_gate_0: There's no getting through the gate.
That's a solid looking gate. And us with no key.
We can't get through - the gate's locked.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_seeing_guardh: A garrison post? I'd welcome more allies at this point.
Is that a guardhouse? They keep slack watch.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_seeing_tavern: It's hard to believe you mayflies drink this sludge.
I think there's more ale on the floor than in the barrels.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_seeing_tower_: The tower! It's not far now.
Cease your grumbling, lumberfoots. We're almost to the tower.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_to_rooftops_0: The higher we ascend, the closer we come.
Do your heads spin yet, lumberfoots?
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_up_stairs_01: So many stairs. This will test your endurance, lumberfoots.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_up_stairs_02: Watch your footing on the steps, mayflies. It's a long way to fall.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_view_tower_01: There, in the distance! Tower of disproportion.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_view_tower_02: That must be the tower with the horn.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_view_tower_03: In the distance, the mayfly tower!
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_view_tower_04: There, the Tower. It's our landmark.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_vista_01: Now this isn't looking good for the mayflies.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_vista_02: The stench of vermin hangs over this town.
pwe_objective_magnus_tower_walking_stree: A typical mayfly nest, if oddly quiet.
The city is much improved when its citizens are silent.
pwe_objective_nearing_objective_deadline: Before you die of old age.
We don't have time for this!
pwe_objective_picking_up_grimoire_01: Ah! It burns with every step.
pwe_objective_picking_up_grimoire_02: It whispers in the spaces between the winds.
pwe_objective_picking_up_grimoire_03: Like teeth, gnawing at my soul.
pwe_objective_picking_up_grimoire_04: Rat-scrawl on every page. This is not a safe prize.
pwe_objective_picking_up_grimoire_05: It sings a song without word, every note the chiming of a lost soul.
pwe_objective_picking_up_grimoire_06: Do not touch it, mayflies. It will devour your brief souls.
pwe_objective_picking_up_grimoire_07: It knows my count? How does it know my count?
pwe_objective_picking_up_grimoire_08: You see pages. I see a bottomless pit, and glinting eyes.
pwe_objective_picking_up_grimoire_12: A foul artefact. Must I bear it?
pwe_objective_skaven_exit_01: Daylight! Or the best we'll get, anyway.
pwe_objective_skaven_exit_02: A breeze. Fresh air. Thank the Ancients.
pwe_objective_skaven_exit_04: The way is open. Just a little further!
pwe_ojective_cemetery_done_01: The festering boil is gone, for now.  We should not linger.
pwe_ojective_cemetery_done_02: Their foul brew is no more. The weave is relieved.
pwe_ojective_cemetery_done_03: We're done here. Or maybe you mayflies would like to stay among these fumes?
pwe_ojective_cemetery_done_04: No mercy for plague peddlers. We should report back.
pwe_painter_conversation_two_01: Only in blood. Would you like me to show you?
pwe_portals_conversation_eight_01: Aye, I did. In the streets of Parravon. The mayflies were torn between respect and fear.
pwe_portals_conversation_eight_02: There was no pretense about those eyes, Sienna.
pwe_portals_conversation_four_01: Not really. Our deeds have bound us to these places.
pwe_portals_conversation_four_02: There's nothing to fear, Bardin... at least, so long as we don't die here.
pwe_portals_conversation_ten_01: It's just as well you're not a steam tank, Saltzpyre. We'd never get you up this hill.
pwe_portals_conversation_two_01: You don't fear returning to the domain of the Great Enchanter, One-Eye?
pwe_portals_conversation_two_02: And what if that history is a lie?
pwe_portals_crypt_event_blood_02: Curse that daemon! Every kill feeds its thirst!
pwe_portals_crypt_event_blood_03: We're slaking the daemon's thirst! See the floor?
pwe_portals_crypt_event_blood_04: The floor's filling up with blood, mayflies!
pwe_portals_crypt_event_demon_voice_03: A daemon? What have you led me to, lumberfoots?
pwe_portals_crypt_event_demon_voice_04: And now there's a daemon laughing at us. Well this gets better and better.
pwe_portals_crypt_event_entering_crypt_0: Well, this is nice. I don't think.
What a horrible detour we've found.
Eyes everywhere. Watching everything. I don't like this, mayflies.
There's something old in this place, lumberfoots.
pwe_portals_crypt_event_hole_01: There! Out, before the daemon comes for us!
pwe_portals_crypt_event_hole_02: Into the hole, while we still can!
pwe_portals_crypt_exit_01: There, we're through the gate. Happy now?
pwe_portals_crypt_exit_02: At least we're through the gate.
pwe_portals_crypt_exit_03: That's the gate, and us on the proper side.
pwe_portals_crypt_exit_04: Well, we're making progress. Slow progress.
pwe_portals_enter_village_01: I've yet to see a mayfly village that can defend itself.
pwe_portals_enter_village_02: Why can't we ever go anywhere nice?
pwe_portals_enter_village_03: The foe is here before us. Let's see what they've prepared.
pwe_portals_enter_village_04: That gate wouldn't have barred a determined mouse, let alone a horde of rats.
pwe_portals_event_missing_gargoyle_heads: Ugly brutes... but I sense there's more to this than wanton destruction.
Hmm I wonder where the heads went?
Whatever happened to the heads, do you suppose?
Can you see the heads anywhere, mayflies?
pwe_portals_everyone_gone_01: Empty as a dwarf's generosity. We're too late.
pwe_portals_everyone_gone_02: No one lives here any longer, mayflies.
pwe_portals_everyone_gone_03: This is a village of the dead.
pwe_portals_everyone_gone_04: There's no one to fight for any longer. Not here.
pwe_portals_find_map_01: I suppose we'd better find the map.
pwe_portals_find_map_02: Eyes sharp, mayflies. The map's likely to be hidden.
pwe_portals_find_map_04: I wonder what crude concealment they've employed?
pwe_portals_find_survivors_02: Eyes peeled. There may be survivors.
pwe_portals_follow_trail_02: Leave the village behind, mayflies. Drachenfels awaits.
pwe_portals_follow_trail_03: Away now, mayflies. This village has nothing to offer.
pwe_portals_get_out_01: We need to be gone from here.
pwe_portals_get_out_02: We can't let them delay us.
pwe_portals_get_out_03: Through, mayflies! Through! Don't let them pin you.
pwe_portals_get_to_temple_01: We'll need that map, which means we need to find the temple.
pwe_portals_get_to_temple_02: (sigh) I suppose we'll need Lohner's map. Where's the temple?
pwe_portals_get_to_temple_03: Head for the temple, mayflies. We'll need the map.
pwe_portals_get_to_temple_04: Hurry, lumberfoots. We must reach the temple and seize the map.
pwe_portals_help_search_01: What makes you exempt from searching?
pwe_portals_help_search_02: Get down here and help out!
pwe_portals_help_search_03: This will only take longer if you don't help!
pwe_portals_help_search_04: Hey, mayfly! Get down here and search!
pwe_portals_intro_line_a_01: We should be there already... You heard, clear as I: "proceed with all haste."
pwe_portals_intro_line_a_02: Why are we not there yet? We need to beat the Pactsworn to Blutberg.
pwe_portals_intro_line_b_01: We should have set out earlier. Now the village's chances are slim.
pwe_portals_intro_line_b_02: Why didn't Lohner tell us sooner? There's every chance we won't make it in time.
pwe_portals_intro_line_c_01: Do you believe Lohner's tale of secret passages, and maps?
pwe_portals_intro_line_c_02: I hope Lohner's secret map exists. We'll need it, if we have to enter Drachenfels itself.
pwe_portals_kidnapped_traces_01: If they seized the villagers, they'll be bound for Drachenfels.
pwe_portals_kidnapped_traces_02: Any captives will be in the cursed castle by now.
pwe_portals_kidnapped_traces_03: If we're to save any of them, we'll have to follow to the castle.
pwe_portals_kidnapped_traces_04: Were I a gambler - which I'm not - I'd wager the Pactsworn have taken prisoners to Drachenfels.
pwe_portals_map_first_clue_01: Ah! That statue! I swear it's on the map.
pwe_portals_map_first_clue_02: Is that the same statue we can see on the map, mayflies?
pwe_portals_map_first_clue_03: That statue might be what we're looking for.
pwe_portals_map_first_clue_04: Wait! I think I recognise that statue.
pwe_portals_map_second_clue_01: The statues are guardians. It's obvious now.
pwe_portals_map_second_clue_02: So the statues are guardians? Seems simple enough.
pwe_portals_map_second_clue_03: The statues are the key. Maybe literally so.
pwe_portals_map_second_clue_04: The statues hold the secret, mayflies.
pwe_portals_memory_path_02: Live long enough, and everywhere looks familiar, but this place...?
pwe_portals_memory_path_04: This all looks familiar, doesn't it mayflies?
pwe_portals_memory_portals_02: Oh, the portals. I'd scrubbed them from my memory.
pwe_portals_memory_portals_03: Ratmen portals? Oh yes, they were here last time, weren't they?
pwe_portals_memory_portals_04: I remember these portals. Horrible, smelly things.
pwe_portals_objective_recap_01: Let's hope the map becomes clearer, the closer we get.
pwe_portals_objective_recap_02: We can't rely on the map, mayflies.
pwe_portals_objective_recap_03: Ach, that map's a mess. We'll have to use our intellect... those of us that are capable.
pwe_portals_objective_recap_04: We'll need instinct to make sense of that map. I hope you're up to it.
pwe_portals_portal_interact_one_04: Are you bored? Should I find you a shiny rock to play with?
pwe_portals_portal_interact_three_04: See? This is what happens when you poke things you shouldn't.
pwe_portals_portal_interact_two_02: Sounds like it's not entirely broken...
pwe_portals_portal_interact_two_03: What good can come of that, exactly?
pwe_portals_pwe_castle_gate_01: We can't get through that gate, mayflies.
pwe_portals_pwe_castle_gate_02: There's no getting over that gate.
pwe_portals_pwe_castle_gate_03: See... Surely that gate's on the map? And a way around?
pwe_portals_pwe_castle_gate_04: That gate has to be on the map... unless we're in the wrong place.
pwe_portals_pwe_castle_road_02: Look for landmarks. Maybe they match some of the squiggle things.
pwe_portals_pwe_castle_road_03: What a worthless map. Still, maybe there are some landmarks we can use.
pwe_portals_pwe_castle_road_04: Look around. Are there any landmarks that match the map?
pwe_portals_pwe_castle_vista_01: You should see this with elf-eyes, mayflies. It's much worse.
pwe_portals_pwe_castle_vista_03: Evil has an aspect all of its own, does it not?
pwe_portals_pwe_castle_vista_04: Evil has deep roots, mayflies. It clings to existence until its last bough withers.
pwe_portals_raid_trace_02: There's no glory in slaughtering the defenceless.
pwe_portals_raid_trace_03: It's not just the slaughter... Why do they have to be so untidy?
pwe_portals_raid_trace_04: Even mayflies should have given better account of themselves than this.
pwe_portals_secret_entrance_gate_opens_0: Our path opens. Doesn't look pleasant.
Be wary, mayflies. Who knows what awaits?
pwe_portals_stairs_01: Did we really come so far down?
pwe_portals_stairs_02: So many stairs. It's quite bracing.
pwe_portals_stairs_03: A leisurely climb, after all else we've seen.
pwe_portals_stairs_04: Almost to the top... I think.
pwe_portals_temple_bell_tower_03: Can I suggest trying the belltower, mayflies?
pwe_portals_temple_event_02: Put the map away, and be ready to fight!
pwe_portals_temple_event_03: Stow the map. We need steel.
pwe_portals_temple_locked_02: I don't suppose Lohner gave one of you the key?
pwe_portals_temple_locked_03: Don't just stare at it! Find another way in.
pwe_portals_temple_locked_04: We need a new way in, mayflies.
pwe_portals_the_map_02: I thought we were looking for a map. Not... whatever that is.
pwe_portals_the_map_03: That's a map? Why do I listen to anything Lohner says?
pwe_portals_the_temple_01: Is that the temple? Hard to tell one crude mayfly building from another.
pwe_portals_trail_found_02: We've a long walk yet. Keep going up!
pwe_portals_trail_found_04: This path will lead us to the castle.
pwe_portals_village_raided_01: If it's killing the Pactsworn want, it's killing they'll get.
pwe_portals_village_raided_02: Let's see how they fare against those who can fight back.
pwe_portals_village_raided_03: Are you prepared, lumberfoots? This will test you.
pwe_portals_village_raided_04: Stay close. We'll fight them together. Or I can fight them, and you can watch.
pwe_portals_waystone_01: We should make use of that waystone. You all look quite tired.
pwe_portals_waystone_02: There's no sense pressing on until you lot are rested.
pwe_portals_waystone_03: You all look fit to drop. Let's return rested.
pwe_portals_waystone_04: We'll be back, make no mistake.
pwe_prologue_meeting_kerillian_01: Aye, she did. She's set up some kind of portal for us on the surface. One-eye is already there.
pwe_prologue_move_b_01: I agree with the old mother. Assuming she has a plan.
pwe_prologue_move_d_01: Tapping into a waystone? That's impressive, for a mayfly.
pwe_prologue_olesya_a_01: Is that Olesya Pimenova? Or am I hearing things?
pwe_prologue_olesya_a_02: I'm further gone than I thought. I'm hearing Olesya Pimenova...
pwe_prologue_portal_01: I don't care what you need, One-eye, I never have, and I never will. But I do fear our paths once more converge.
pwe_prologue_portal_b_01: Can't say I've missed that tone.
pwe_prologue_portal_d_01: Let's hope the old mother has her enchantments in hand...
pwe_sh_level_bogenhafen_city_dead_priest: Where is your meek and cowardly God now, priest? You should have trod a bloodier path.
pwe_sh_level_bogenhafen_city_defiled_01: Pfah! A temple should be defiled by the entrails of its congregation, not... this.
pwe_sh_level_bogenhafen_city_here_they_c: Really? You come for me? I am a daughter of Clar Karond! A bloodied child of Khaine!
pwe_sh_level_bogenhafen_city_infestation: My patron has no love for the Dark Gods. Their ways of murder are so... unrefined.
pwe_sh_level_bogenhafen_city_revelry_01: Give me an hour, and I'll turn that laughter to dying screams. Please? It'll be fun.
pwe_sh_level_bogenhafen_city_sewers_01: As ever, the swiftest root to the heart is through the bowels...
pwe_sh_level_bogenhafen_slum_escape_01: Keep up! I shan't wait for you!
pwe_sh_level_bogenhafen_slum_gang_01: This gang? Mere children. They should leave murder to those who now.
pwe_sh_level_bogenhafen_slum_slum_01: We should kill anyone we find. It would be a mercy.
pwe_sh_level_bogenhafen_slum_stolen_good: Only amateurs steal goods. A true thief purloins life. Oh, the rush of blood over your hands...
pwe_sh_level_bogenhafen_slum_tainted_foo: Even the poison is feeble. Do they not know how to brew manbane and dark venom?
pwe_sh_level_bogenhafen_slum_the_58_01: I have kin who trade. But their business is in flayed human skin. They're quite wealthy, actually.
pwe_skaven_stronghold_intro_a_01: Cutting off a rat's head has always been the best way to stop its foul tail from twitching.
pwe_skaven_stronghold_intro_a_02: Tricking Skaven? Easier than fooling a dwarf, you'll see.
pwe_skaven_stronghold_intro_b_01: Come on then, mayflies. Even you should have the hang of it by now.
pwe_skaven_stronghold_intro_b_02: Except for the 'stealthy lumberfoot' part, this seems a sensible plan.
pwe_skaven_stronghold_intro_c_01: Ay, just try not to wake the whole nest, lumberfoots.
pwe_skaven_stronghold_intro_c_02: Can we get moving? Before the Skaven die of old age.
pwe_skittergate_intro_a_01: I am truly speechless. This plan... ah... no, I'll be quiet.
pwe_skittergate_intro_a_02: Oh, how I wish Lohner and Olesya had been completely wrong just once, so I could muster enough doubt to tell them where to stick this idiot plan.
pwe_skittergate_intro_b_01: It is the only way, and the only way it is. The way it only is. How many variations do you need, mayflies?
pwe_skittergate_intro_b_02: We all had ample time to back out of this, but we're past the point of no return... unless you're a coward.
pwe_skittergate_intro_c_01: Savour the moment, mayflies. Either way, you don't have many left.
pwe_skittergate_intro_c_02: Can we please pick up the pace? This will be hard enough, without us plodding along like a hobbled ox.
pwe_skittergate_power_up_a_01: So, we came here to destroy the skittergate, but now we'll have to power the wretched thing up.
pwe_skittergate_power_up_a_02: The gate's only dormant. Good for us, if we want to get home. Bad for Helmgart.
pwe_skittergate_power_up_b_01: The Skaven will have more warpstone nearby. We need only find it.
pwe_skittergate_power_up_b_02: Then we seek fresh warpstone, and put it to use.
pwe_skittergate_power_up_c_01: And when it's powered, we can have the machine do itself a mischief.
pwe_skittergate_power_up_c_02: Escape should not be our priority. The destruction of the gate comes first.
pwe_st_bastion_briefing_01: This is no simple kidnapping. Foul sorcery hangs about Castle Drachenfels like a mantle, and I dread to think what occurs within the walls. Rescue is needed for those the Pactsworn have taken, but I feel a strange foreboding ...
pwe_st_bastion_briefing_02: It seems we are to return to Castle Drachenfels to help those who cannot help themselves. I suppose that makes us heroes. Or fools. It's so hard to tell the two apart when I look at the company I keep.
pwe_st_bell_intro_c_02: All your yammer, meat. It's enough to make me long for someone's death. Could be yours. Could be mine.
pwe_st_bless_conversation_seven_01: Would you say you hear Sigmar's voice clearer these days, meat?
pwe_st_bless_conversation_seven_02: You should be carefully of godly intent, One-Eye. I know better than any how it can run strange roads.
pwe_st_bless_conversation_seven_03: Believe as you wish. The truth will make itself known.
pwe_st_bless_conversation_six_01: You? Who went running into the past to re-embrace one who'd already led you astray? I moved forward.
pwe_st_castle_briefing_01: A Rotblood sorcerer has made Castle Drachenfels his squalid nest. I feel no desire to return, but I suppose he'll have to be chastened, if only to set an example to his grubby little peers. So, let's get it over with. Maybe then I can put the place behind me for good.
pwe_st_castle_briefing_02: Castle Drachenfels has become a Rotblood lair, and I've a wee notion that we shouldn't let some fat, arrogant sorcerer have the run of the place. There are perils enough within those stones already, and we've trouble enough without encouraging more.
pwe_st_crater_loading_screen_01: Mother Olesya won't stop wittering about that meteor. Premonitions of doom and destruction ... I'd put her straight, but I think she might be right. My dreams were troubled last night, and I've learned to trust their wisdom. So rock-hunting it is.
pwe_st_crater_loading_screen_02: A meteor crashed last night. Lohner thinks it's trouble. I agree, for the Weave is restless ... and that means warpstone. Much as I'd rather stay far away, we'll have to take a look. It'll only be trouble if the ratmen get ahold of it.
pwe_st_gameplay_hears_incoming_horde_21: I'll not run from them, meat.
pwe_st_gameplay_hears_incoming_horde_22: You think that's a lot? Bloodlings, this is nothing.
pwe_st_gameplay_seeing_a_chaos_spawn_07: That's what worship of the Dark Ones gets you, meat.
pwe_st_gameplay_seeing_a_chaos_warrior_0: Over there, meat! A Chaos Warrior!
pwe_st_gameplay_seeing_a_chaos_wizard_wi: Meat, kindly kill that Sorcerer before he drowns us in filth.
pwe_st_gameplay_seeing_a_scr_01: Watch out for Shield Rats, bloodlings!
pwe_st_gameplay_seeing_a_Skaven_patrol_s: Blackrats! Are you ready for this, meat?
pwe_st_gameplay_seeing_a_stormfiend_03: A Stormfiend comes. Move yourselves, bloodlings!
pwe_st_gameplay_seeing_a_troll_03: Ah, it's only a Troll, meat. It could be worse.
pwe_st_loading_screen_bell_01: There's a warpstone bell up on Helmgart's walls, and that's not good for anyone. It's even giving the mayflies sore ears, and I've a headache fit to crack stone. There's nothing else for it - we'll have to teach the ratmen the value of silence.
pwe_st_loading_screen_bell_02: The ratmen have raised a bell on Helmgart's walls. Might be a Screaming Bell. It might not. Either way, I agree with Lohner - the scunnered thing will have to come down, if only so we can have a little bit of peace and quiet.
pwe_st_loading_screen_catacombs_01: If ever there was a place that shouldn't stink of dark magic, it's a Shallyan hospice. What are the Pactsworn up to down there? I suppose there's nothing for it but to go and take a wee look, and remonstrate, where appropriate.
pwe_st_loading_screen_catacombs_02: The Pactsworn are causing mischief in a mayfly hospice. Presumably because picking on those who can fight back is beyond their meagre reserves of courage. Isn't it a shame that we're onto them?
pwe_st_loading_screen_cemetary_01: The Weave is shuddering - the ratmen are brewing vile poison in Morr's Field. It's only a matter of time before it spreads, so for once Lohner and I find ourselves in accord as to what must be done. The 'what' being put an end to the ratman mischief. Permanently.
pwe_st_loading_screen_cemetary_02: The ratmen are brewing poison in the Garden of Morr. Likely they're using mayfly corpses to do it, which is thrify of the wee scunners if nothing else. But it remains an affront to the Weave, so they won't be making their concoctions for much longer.
pwe_st_loading_screen_chaos_war_camp_01: The northlanders are very unhappy with our recent deeds. It's so nice when one's efforts are appreciated, don't you think? Their chief - with the ridiculous name of Bödvarr Ribspreader - is looking for our keep. He'll have to be dissuaded. Permanently.
pwe_st_loading_screen_chaos_war_camp_02: Bödvarr Ribspreader. Bödvarr Ribspreader? For that name alone he deserves to die. And die he will. Not for his ridiculous name - more's the pity - but for trying to locate Taal's Horn Keep. We can't have that, so let the bloody remonstration begin.
pwe_st_loading_screen_crawl_01: Lohner's insisting we all head into Helmgart for a wee drink. I've nothing against that, not as such, but why do I have to do it in the company of mayflies? Oh well, I suppose there's no avoiding it. At least I can show the other how an elf maid holds her drink. That'll put them in their place.
pwe_st_loading_screen_crawl_02: Helmgart is quiet - at least for the moment. That much is fine. The problem is, Lohner's decided we need to have what he refers to as 'a bit of quality downtime' by which he means I should go drinking with the mayflies. Why, I ask you, would I want to do that?
pwe_st_loading_screen_dlc_bogenhafen_01: Lohner's had word from a Father Kraussman, insisting that the Bögenhafen plague is due to a Chaos runesword, which we will have to retrieve if the town's to be spared. Don't we just get all of the nice jobs? I mean, would anyone miss Bögenhafen?
pwe_st_loading_screen_dlc_bogenhafen_02: So it appears that the trouble in Bögenhafen's down to a Chaos runesword. We're to seize the scunnered thing and get it somewhere safe. All well and good - I suppose - but I've a foreboding that it'll mean trudging through a sewer. Again.
pwe_st_loading_screen_dlc_pit_01: Bögenhafen is in the grips of a plague, and Lohner's convinced it's the work of the Pactsworn. Maybe he's right, maybe he's not, but there's no way to know for certain until we have a wee look around the place. You never know ...
pwe_st_loading_screen_dlc_pit_02: Apparently there's plague in Bögenhafen. Lohner, not realising that there's plague everywhere, wants us to investigate. I'll be honest, I don't want to... but what would happen to the mayflies if I stayed behind? Nothing good.
pwe_st_loading_screen_elven_ruins_01: The bridge of shadows isn't working as it should, so Olesya wants us to head to Athel Yenlui and put an end to the interference. I ... don't know that I want to go. Too many memories waiting to be stirred up. Too many regrets.
pwe_st_loading_screen_elven_ruins_02: Mother Olesya's bridge of shadows is experiencing problems. She's tracked the interference back to the ruined temple of Athel Yenlui, and we're to investigate. I wonder if it'll feel like being back home? As if I care.
pwe_st_loading_screen_farmland_01: The Pactsworn can't handle a proper fight, so now they're going after terrified peasants. Worthless scunners! I suspect we'll get there too late to do much good, but we can at least register our disapproval in the severest of terms.
pwe_st_loading_screen_farmland_02: The Pactsworn are terrorising the farms around Ussingen. As much as I've little sympathy for mayflies who can't be bothered to learn to wield a sword, I find it all strangely annoying. Still, I'll feel better when the blood starts flowing and the screaming begins.
pwe_st_loading_screen_forest_ambush_01: The ratmen are up to something out in the forest, clamouring night and day to make their ramshackle war machines. Lohner says we should go out there and destroy them. Well, I say that surely beats staying here listening to Goreksson's singing.
pwe_st_loading_screen_forest_ambush_02: We've been told that the ratmen are building war engines out in the forest. Well, we can't have that, can we? Another mission for Kerillian the Extraordinarily Heroic and her mayfly companions. Assuming they don't get themselves killed.
pwe_st_loading_screen_fort_01: What if a handful of mayflies have gotten themselves trapped in Fort Brachsenbrücke? It's hardly my concern. Or it shouldn't be. But if I don't agree to go, Lohner will try that 'reverse psychology' of his again, and the poor man looks so pathetic that I'll start laughing at him. Again.
pwe_st_loading_screen_fort_02: A mayfly fort is under siege by the Pactsworn. I keep telling Lohner that we're not exactly short of mayflies, but he insists we help the defenders out of the mess they've landed themselves in. I suppose it's as good a place as any to make partial amends for Hoggar's Bridge.
pwe_st_loading_screen_ground_zero_01: Lohner's spinning a tale of a Rotblood sorcerer making trouble in Helmgart's ruins. I have generously decided to go along and end the scunner's foul existence. Someone's got to show the mayflies how it's done.
pwe_st_loading_screen_ground_zero_02: A Rotblood sorcerer is making trouble in Helmgart. I say the town's beyond saving anyway, but Lohner - foolish mayfly that he is - doesn't agree. I suppose I could sit this one out, but the others would only get themselves killed.
pwe_st_loading_screen_helmgart_military_: Olesya has gone into Helmgart to spy on the ratmen, and we're to create a distraction to make her life easier. So off to the Temple of Sigmar we go to ring out the bells. What can possibly go wrong with that? How long have you got?

Lohner wants us to cause a distraction. I suggested stripping Saltzpyre naked and hanging him from the city walls, but apparently that was a bit…too much. Instead, we're going to ring the bells at the Temple of Sigmar. Oh well, maybe next time.
pwe_st_loading_screen_magnus_tower_01: Why did I ever come to Ubersreik? There are rats everywhere, and now the city's under siege. Brilliant. Just brilliant! These mayflies have begged me to help them sound the alarm, and I've agreed. Twice the fool, I suppose. Still, at least it won't be boring.
pwe_st_loading_screen_magnus_tower_02: Ubersreik's under attack - as if I care - but I suppose there's no harm killing a few marauding ratmen. These mayflies are sure to make a botch of it without me. We're off to the Horn of Magnus to sound the alarm, but I'm sure I'll be doing all the work.
pwe_st_loading_screen_mines_01: Is there no end to the northlanders' vile deeds? Trolls are foul enough without anyone splicing them with sorcery or daemons or whatever madcap scheme they've settled upon. They all have to die. What a shame. What a terrible, terrible, terrible shame.
pwe_st_loading_screen_mines_02: The northlanders are breeding trolls down in an abandoned mine. Full points for ingenuity, if not for taste. Still, we can't have the brutish things wandering around, can we? The hard part will be to stop Goreksson cooking the remains, mark my words.
pwe_st_loading_screen_nurgle_01: We go to the nicest places. This time it's a swamp, where the Rotbloods are excavating a vile and ancient idol. I suppose we'd better do something about it, otherwise I'll never hear the end of it. At least it can't smell worse than the dwarf.
pwe_st_loading_screen_nurgle_02: [Disgusted noise]. The Rotbloods are digging around in the swamp. Now, you'd think it's the best place for them - and you'd be right - but Lohner says they're looking to harness the power of an ancient monolith. Can't have that.
pwe_st_loading_screen_skaven_stronghold_: The dwarfs, alas, have allowed the hold of Karak Gnol to fall into skaven hands. Careless. Very, very careless. So it's up to us to set matters right, and issue notice of eviction, inked in ratman blood. Another one Goreksson's going to owe me, but who's keeping count? Apart from me, obviously.

Dwarf holds attract all manner of vile, squalid creatures with aspirations of competence - starting, of course, with the dwarfs themselves. Karak Gnol, however, lies in the hands of a skaven warlord who needs to be quietly dislodged from this sphere of existence.
pwe_st_loading_screen_skittergate_01: If Lohner's to be believed, the Skittergate's no longer guarded so closely as to make a direct assault a suicide mission, which I suppose is for the best. There'll be no peace until we destroy the foul contraption, and I so long for a bit of peace and quiet.
pwe_st_loading_screen_skittergate_02: The ratmen are using one of their vile contraptions to keep reinforcements flooding in from the frozen north, and I for one am quite sick of it. So we're going to go up there  and ask them politely to desist. And then we're going to break their toy to little pieces.
pwe_st_loading_screen_ussingen_01: The Rotbloods have seized Ussingen, and are even now using the Baron's manor as a storehouse for their plundered provisions. That's right - everything's in one place, just waiting to be burned, blown up or otherwise spoiled. This one ought to be fun.
pwe_st_loading_screen_ussingen_02: It would appear that the northlanders, having a slender grip on practicalities such as 'logistics' and 'provisions' have filled the Baron's manor to the rafters with food supplies. Can't have that, can we? It'll all have to burn.
pwe_st_objective_cemetery_bringing_down_: Get out of the way, meat!
pwe_st_objective_goal_achieved_more_left: It's only a start, meat. We've more yet.
pwe_st_objective_magnus_tower_up_stairs_: So many stairs. This will test your endurance, meat.
pwe_st_portals_briefing_01: The Pactsworn - never ones to shy for cowardly deeds - are stealing folk from the villages around Castle Drachenfels. Will they never learn? Sienna's all for intervening, and so am I. For kidnappers should never prosper.
pwe_st_portals_briefing_02: Castle Drachenfels. Lileath, but I'd hoped never to hear that name again, however the Pactsworn are making free with the local villagers, and I feel an overpowering urge to offer the chastisement of blade and bow. So, let the hunt begin.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_eighteen_01: You still don't understand, do you? I am what I always was, only moreso. I am myself, unbounded by the whims of meat.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_eighteen_02: I am free. If that appals you so, bring on the flame! We shall see which of us survives it!
pwe_st_woods_conversation_eight_01: You do know we're talking about the High Elf Everqueen?
pwe_st_woods_conversation_eight_02: They would slice you to tiny pieces and cast them, away, into the sea.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_eleven_02: Not in any way you'd understand.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_eleven_03: I ... So help me, Goreksson ... I don't know any longer.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_fifteen_01: The gods? Aye, maybe. The goddesses? No. They nurse a grudge like you wouldn't believe, and it makes them mighty.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_fifteen_02: Oh good. That's a weight off my mind.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_five_01: Meat and their allegiances! Aye, some of us are bound to Isha. But we're free to worship as we wish, and Isha ...
pwe_st_woods_conversation_fourteen_01: Did I make a mistake Goreksson? Becoming what I am?
pwe_st_woods_conversation_fourteen_02: Aye, but you do make a lot of mistakes. In this, if nowhere else, I'd value your counsel.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_four_01: How many times? I'm not part tree. I'm one with the forest and the Weave. A herald of Cadai and Cytharai. It's different.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_four_02: Hah! The hypocrisy of meat! Or was that not a schematic for a mechanical arm I saw in your workshop.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_nineteen_01: How very generous ... Could it be that you're tempted by the truths I've seen?
pwe_st_woods_conversation_nineteen_02: Aye, dignity. So important. You mustn't feel ashamed that I intrigue you.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_one_01: I have no alliance with meat, Kruber. You're part of the problem.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_one_02: Oh, hush. I'd never hurt you. When the moment comes, it'll be painless.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_seventeen_01: Believe what you will, and chance the consequences. I am beyond such concerns.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_seventeen_02: My eyes are open as never before. I suggest you leave it at that.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_seven_01: Will you not leave it well alone, meat?
pwe_st_woods_conversation_seven_02: [Sigh of Defeat] She's dead. An interloper stole all that made her who she was.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_sixteen_01: Didn you not know? I was always evil. Except for when I wasn't.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_sixteen_02: Just assume everything's a little bit closer to the surface now  ... and sleep lightly.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_six_01: No. You were talking about Isha. I was casually deflecting.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_six_02: She is ... Not what she was. She's not even who she was.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_ten_01: As I've said many times before - so many times - I'm not part tree. I'm part of the forest.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_thirteen_01: The world is so different now. I no longer hear the Weave ... I feel it pulsing where my heart used to be.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_thirteen_02: Want me to show you yours? Atharti could have it for a snack.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_three_01: So he sends one obsessive to fix another? I'm not a machine to be repaired, Goreksson.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_three_02: You're a good friend. I'll try to remember that. If I'm allowed.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_twelve_01: Leave me be, Goreksson. I've had my fill of your questions.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_twelve_02: Aye. Maybe. I don't know any longer. I don't know what it all means.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_twentyfive_01: And from whence hails your knowledge, might I ask?
pwe_st_woods_conversation_twentyfive_02: Aye. There's many a man happier for thinking we're all helpless wee butterfly maidens. But some of us bite.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_twentyfour_01: All is as it should be. Hekarti grants me the power, Atharti the will to see it used. Isha's memory binds me to the Weave and Lileath's love to the Light. And the Morai-Heg keeps the balance.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_twentyfour_02: ... Kill me swiftly. For all our sakes.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_twentyone_02: Isha is dead. Lileath ... does not answer my prayers as she once did. We seek hope where we can.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_twentythree_01: I know what you're thinking, Sienna, but Atharti isn't evil. She's the Goddess of Desire.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_twentythree_02: That's a misunderstanding. Surely you approve of her sister Hekarti?
pwe_st_woods_conversation_twentythree_03: Look, she doesn't kill people. She just knows when they're going to die ... and very occasionally speeds it along.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_twenty_01: Is that outrage I hear? Or jealousy? ... Or temptation?
pwe_st_woods_conversation_twenty_02: You may worship me, if you'd like. I'll not breathe a word to the others ... If you ask nicely.
pwe_st_woods_conversation_two_01: I ... I'm sorry, Kruber. Truly. What I am now ... it's like the best of what I used to be, and the worst. Does that make any sense to you?
pwe_st_woods_conversation_two_02: There's no hope for any of us. Not one branch. Not one leaf.
pwe_targeted_by_ratling_01: The rat's wants to shoot me dead, hah!
pwe_targeted_by_ratling_02: The vermin gun is targeting me!
pwe_targeted_by_ratling_04: I'm the one he's aiming for! Kill it!
pwe_targeted_by_ratling_05: The filthy rat gunner tries to keep up with me, hah!
pwe_targeted_by_ratling_07: The gunner aims for me! You flank it!
pwe_targeted_by_ratling_10: Flank the gun-rat while it's shooting me!
pwe_targeted_by_ratling_12: Gun-rat's got me in its sights.
pwe_targeted_by_ratling_13: Hah! The gun-rat's obsessed with me!
pwe_targeted_by_ratling_14: So many shots, Ratling. All for me?
pwe_ussingen_intro_a_01: Feels good to be on the offensive again. Let's find that manor.
pwe_ussingen_intro_b_01: I'll gladly deny the Urithairi food and supplies. I'll deny them life alongside.
pwe_ussingen_intro_b_02: We go in. We burn the supplies. We get out. No complications.
pwe_ussingen_intro_c_01: Are we done posturing? I'm bored.
pwe_whispers_conversation_four_01: You needn't waste your time. We've nothing to discuss.
pwe_whisper_conversation_nine_01: I don't think so, old mother. Words cannot silence the past, only deeds.
pwe_whisper_conversation_twelve_01: At Castle Drachenfels... Look, I don't know how to say this...
pwe_whisper_conversation_twelve_02: Nothing good can come of discussing the matter?
pwe_wind_beast_intro_banter_a_01: Charoi - the essence of a hunter.
pwe_wind_beast_intro_banter_a_02: The Wind of Beasts. Hear it howl.
pwe_wind_beast_intro_banter_b_01: Rage is nothing without guiding will.
pwe_wind_beast_intro_banter_b_02: It calls to me. I long to obey.
pwe_wind_death_intro_banter_a_01: We walk the fields of Cynath.
pwe_wind_death_intro_banter_a_02: The Wind of Death calls us home.
pwe_wind_death_intro_banter_b_01: We are dead already. There is only denial.
pwe_wind_death_intro_banter_b_02: Do you not hear the voices?
pwe_wind_fire_intro_banter_a_01: Asur. The kingly flame. The creator.
pwe_wind_fire_intro_banter_a_02: The Wind of Fire; the voice of truth.
pwe_wind_fire_intro_banter_b_01: Mortals should not walk the flame long.
pwe_wind_fire_intro_banter_b_02: Have a care. Fire plays no favourites.
pwe_wind_heavens_intro_banter_a_01: In Elthrai, all things are possible.
pwe_wind_heavens_intro_banter_a_02: The Wind of Heavens. The font of fate.
pwe_wind_heavens_intro_banter_b_01: Fortune will not always favour us.
pwe_wind_heavens_intro_banter_b_02: The air is suffused with hopelessness.
pwe_wind_life_intro_banter_a_02: Rapture! The Wind of Life is all.
pwe_wind_life_intro_banter_b_01: Serenity should always be sought, mayflies.
pwe_wind_light_intro_banter_a_01: Honorable Lecai. We don't belong here.
pwe_wind_light_intro_banter_a_02: Lost in the Wind of Light. A recurring dream.
pwe_wind_light_intro_banter_b_02: Such contentment, but it cannot be trusted.
pwe_wind_metal_intro_banter_a_02: The Wind of Metal pleas for change.
pwe_wind_metal_intro_banter_b_01: The alchemy of fate remakes us all.
pwe_wind_shadow_intro_banter_a_02: There is little truth in the Wind of Shadow.
pwe_wind_shadow_intro_banter_b_01: Secrets and lies. We are fashioned of them.
pwe_wind_shadow_intro_banter_b_02: What is hidden is ever the most powerful.
pwe_witch_hunter_eaten_01: Chaos Spawn! One-eye! Oh, I knew sparks would fly!
pwe_witch_hunter_eaten_02: One-eye's got a Chaos Spawn hungry for his liver! Shall we join the dance?
pwe_witch_hunter_eaten_03: Thrasher found himself a One-eye! We can't let the monster eat him, it'll regain its strength.
pwe_witch_hunter_eaten_04: There's a Chaos Spawn stuffing its mouths full of One-Eye. Ach, sickening, in so many ways.
pwe_witch_hunter_eaten_05: One-eye, don't let this go to your head, but I do prefer you over a Thrasher. I think we can build on this.
pwe_witch_hunter_eaten_06: Thrasher's caught One-eye! It's our move now, mayflies.
pwe_witch_hunter_eaten_07: Chaos Spawn eating bits off One-eye! Is it only using one of its disgusting feeder-holes?
pwe_wv_afternoon_rain_01: Blessed rain. Is it not wonderful?
pwe_wv_afternoon_rain_02: Feel the rain, mayflies. Let it wash away your ills.
pwe_wv_dawn_rain_01: Dawn rain is for cleansing the spirit of sins, mayflies. It'll be busy with us.
pwe_wv_dawn_rain_02: Nothing like morning rain to wash away the mind's cobwebs and liven the limbs.
pwe_wv_dawn_snow_01: A cold way to start the day ... at least, for mayflies.
pwe_wv_dawn_snow_02: A glorious, snowy dawn ... why do I get the sense you lot aren't enjoying it?
pwe_wv_dusk_rain_01: Rain at eventide speaks to sorrow and loss.
pwe_wv_dusk_rain_02: Don't fret about the rain, lumberfoots. It'll do you good.
pwe_wv_dusk_snow_01: Stop shivering, mayflies. You're making *me* cold.
pwe_wv_dusk_snow_02: Stop scowling at the snow, lumberfoots. It won't kill you.
pwe_wv_dusk_storm_01: Why the long faces? This is fine weather for fighting.
pwe_wv_dusk_storm_02: Look at you lot, shivering. Can't always fight in the sunshine, you know.
pwe_wv_midday_sunny_01: A glorious day for leaf and limb.
pwe_wv_midday_sunny_02: See? It's sunny ... You wait, you'll be moaning about it being too warm.
pwe_wv_midnight_clear_01: It's a clear night. The Weave is holding its breath.
pwe_wv_midnight_clear_02: Is the night sky not beautiful, mayflies? It, at least, is free of pactsworn.
pwe_wv_midnight_fog_01: A shrouded night. What lurks behind the veil, I wonder?
pwe_wv_midnight_fog_02: Don't get lost in the mist, lumberfoots.
pwe_wv_midnight_storm_01: So it's a dark and stormy night, is it?
pwe_wv_midnight_storm_02: Fear not, mayflies. There's nothing worse than us loose in this night.
